g4102.definition: [πίστις] from {{g3982}}; persuasion, i.e. credence; moral conviction (of religious truth, or the truthfulness of God or a religious teacher), especially reliance upon Christ for salvation; abstractly, constancy in such profession; by extension, the system of religious (Gospel) truth itself

g4105.definition: [πλανάω] from {{g4106}}; to (properly, cause to) roam (from safety, truth, or virtue)

g4106.definition: [πλάνη] feminine of {{g4108}} (as abstractly); objectively, fraudulence; subjectively, a straying from orthodoxy or piety

g4107.definition: [πλανήτης] from {{g4108}}; a rover ("planet"), i.e. (figuratively) an erratic teacher

g4108.definition: [πλάνος] of uncertain affinity; roving (as a tramp), i.e. (by implication) an impostor or misleader;

g4109.definition: [πλάξ] from {{g4111}}; a moulding-board, i.e. flat surface ("plate", or tablet, literally or figuratively)

g4111.definition: [πλάσσω] a primary verb; to mould, i.e. shape or fabricate

g4112.definition: [πλαστός] from {{g4111}}; moulded, i.e. (by implication) artificial or (figuratively) fictitious (false)

g4113.definition: [πλατεῖα] feminine of {{g4116}}; a wide "plat" or "place", i.e. open square

g4118.definition: [πλεῖστος] irregular superlative of {{g4183}}; the largest number or very large

g4119.definition: [πλείων] , or neuter      πλεῖον, or      πλέονcomparative of {{g4183}}; more in quantity, number, or quality; also (in plural) the major portion

g4120.definition: [πλέκω] a primary word; to twine or braid

g4121.definition: [πλεονάζω] from {{g4119}}; to do, make or be more, i.e. increase (transitively or intransitively); by extension, to superabound

g4122.definition: [πλεονεκτέω] from {{g4123}}; to be covetous, i.e. (by implication) to over-reach

g4123.definition: [πλεονέκτης] from {{g4119}} and {{g2192}}; holding (desiring) more, i.e. eager for gain (avaricious, hence a defrauder)

g4124.definition: [πλεονεξία] from {{g4123}}; avarice, i.e. (by implication) fraudulency, extortion

g4125.definition: [πλευρά] of uncertain affinity; a rib, i.e. (by extension) side

g4126.definition: [πλέω] ,   another form for      πλεύω;  which is used as an alternate in certain                        tenses; probably a form of {{g4150}} (through the idea of plunging through the water); to pass in a vessel See also {{g4130}}.

g4127.definition: [πληγή] from {{g4141}}; a stroke; by implication, a wound; figuratively, a calamity

g4128.definition: [πλῆθος] from {{g4130}}; a fulness, i.e. a large number, throng, populace

g4129.definition: [πληθύνω] from another form of {{g4128}}; to increase (transitively or intransitively)

g4130.definition: [πλήθω] ; a prolonged form of a primary      πλέω    (which appears only as an alternate in                          certain tenses and in the reduplicated form                          pimplemi); to "fill" (literally or figuratively (imbue, influence, supply)); specially, to fulfil (time)

g4132.definition: [πλήμμυρα] prolonged from {{g4130}}; flood-tide, i.e. (by analogy) a freshet

g4133.definition: [πλήν] from {{g4119}}; moreover (besides), i.e. albeit, save that, rather, yet

g4134.definition: [πλήρης] from {{g4130}}; replete, or covered over; by analogy, complete

g4135.definition: [πληροφορέω] from {{g4134}} and {{g5409}}; to carry out fully (in evidence), i.e. completely assure (or convince), entirely accomplish

g4137.definition: [πληρόω] from {{g4134}}; to make replete, i.e. (literally) to cram (a net), level up (a hollow), or (figuratively) to furnish (or imbue, diffuse, influence), satisfy, execute (an office), finish (a period or task), verify (or coincide with a prediction), etc.

g4138.definition: [πλήρωμα] from {{g4137}}; repletion or completion, i.e. (subjectively) what fills (as contents, supplement, copiousness, multitude), or (objectively) what is filled (as container, performance, period)

g4139.definition: [πλησίον] neuter of a derivative of πέλας (near); (adverbially) close by; as noun, a neighbor, i.e. fellow (as man, countryman, Christian or friend)

g4140.definition: [πλησμονή] from a presumed derivative of {{g4130}}; a filling up, i.e. (figuratively) gratification

g4141.definition: [πλήσσω] apparently another form of {{g4111}} (through the idea of flattening out); to pound, i.e. (figuratively) to inflict with (calamity) Compare {{g5180}}.

g4142.definition: [πλοιάριον] neuter of a presumed derivative of {{g4143}}; a boat

g4147.definition: [πλουτέω] from {{g4148}}; to be (or become) wealthy (literally or figuratively)

g4149.definition: [πλοῦτος] from the base of {{g4130}}; wealth (as fulness), i.e. (literally) money, possessions, or (figuratively) abundance, richness, (specially), valuable bestowment

g4150.definition: [πλύνω] a prolonged form of an obsolete πλύω (to "flow"); to "plunge", i.e. launder clothing Compare {{g3068}}, {{g3538}}.

g4151.definition: [πνεῦμα] from {{g4154}}; a current of air, i.e. breath (blast) or a breeze; by analogy or figuratively, a spirit, i.e. (human) the rational soul, (by implication) vital principle, mental disposition, etc., or (superhuman) an angel, demon, or (divine) God, Christ's spirit, the Holy Spirit Compare {{g5590}}.

g4152.definition: [πνευματικός] from {{g4151}}; non-carnal, i.e. (humanly) ethereal (as opposed to gross), or (dæmoniacally) a spirit (concretely), or (divinely) supernatural, regenerate, religious Compare {{g5591}}.

g4153.definition: [πνευματικῶς] adverb from {{g4152}}; non-physically, i.e. divinely, figuratively

g4154.definition: [πνέω] a primary word; to breathe hard, i.e. breeze Compare {{g5594}}.

g4155.definition: [πνίγω] strengthened from {{g4154}}; to wheeze, i.e. (causative, by implication) to throttle or strangle (drown)

g4156.definition: [πνικτός] from {{g4155}}; throttled, i.e. (neuter concretely) an animal choked to death (not bled)

g4158.definition: [ποδήρης] from {{g4228}} and another element of uncertain affinity; a dress ({{g2066}} implied) reaching the ankles

g4159.definition: [πόθεν] from the base of {{g4213}} with enclitic adverb of origin; from which (as interrogative) or what (as relative) place, state, source or cause

g4160.definition: [ποιέω] apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do (in a very wide application, more or less direct) Compare {{g4238}}.

g4161.definition: [ποίημα] from {{g4160}}; a product, i.e. fabric (literally or figuratively)

g4162.definition: [ποίησις] from {{g4160}}; action, i.e. performance (of the law)

g4164.definition: [ποικίλος] of uncertain derivation; motley, i.e. various in character

g4165.definition: [ποιμαίνω] from {{g4166}}; to tend as a shepherd of (figuratively, superviser)

g4166.definition: [ποιμήν] of uncertain affinity; a shepherd (literally or figuratively)

g4167.definition: [ποίμνη] contraction from {{g4165}}; a flock (literally or figuratively)

g4168.definition: [ποίμνιον] neuter of a presumed derivative of {{g4167}}; a flock, i.e. (figuratively) group (of believers)

g4169.definition: [ποῖος] from the base of {{g4226}} and {{g3634}}; individualizing interrogative (of character) what sort of, or (of number) which one

g4170.definition: [πολεμέω] from {{g4171}}; to be (engaged) in warfare, i.e. to battle (literally or figuratively)

g4171.definition: [πόλεμος] from πέλομαι (to bustle); warfare (literally or figuratively; a single encounter or a series)

g4172.definition: [πόλις] probably from the same as {{g4171}}, or perhaps from {{g4183}}; a town (properly, with walls, of greater or less size)

g4173.definition: [πολιτάρχης] from {{g4172}} and {{g757}}; a town-officer, i.e. magistrate

g4176.definition: [πολιτεύομαι] middle voice of a derivative of {{g4177}}; to behave as a citizen (figuratively)

g4178.definition: [πολλάκις] multiplicative adverb from {{g4183}}; many times, i.e. frequently

g4179.definition: [πολλαπλασίων] from {{g4183}} and probably a derivative of {{g4120}}; manifold, i.e. (neuter as noun) very much more

g4180.definition: [πολυλογία] from a compound of {{g4183}} and {{g3056}}; loquacity, i.e. prolixity

g4181.definition: [πολυμερῶς] adverb from a compound of {{g4183}} and {{g3313}}; in many portions, i.e. variously as to time and agency (piecemeal)

g4182.definition: [πολυποίκιλος] from {{g4183}} and {{g4164}}; much variegated, i.e. multifarious

g4183.definition: [πολύς] including the forms from the alternate πολλός; (singular) much (in any respect) or (plural) many; neuter (singular) as adverbial, largely; neuter (plural) as adverb or noun often, mostly, largely Compare {{g4118}}, {{g4119}}.

g4187.definition: [πολυτρόπως] adverb from a compound of {{g4183}} and {{g5158}}; in many ways, i.e. variously as to method or form

g4188.definition: [πόμα] from the alternate of {{g4095}}; a beverage

g4189.definition: [πονηρία] from {{g4190}}; depravity, i.e. (specially), malice; plural (concretely) plots, sins

g4190.definition: [πονηρός] from a derivative of {{g4192}}; hurtful, i.e. evil (properly, in effect or influence, and thus differing from {{g2556}}, which refers rather to essential character, as well as from {{g4550}}, which indicates degeneracy from original virtue); figuratively, calamitous; also (passively) ill, i.e. diseased; but especially (morally) culpable, i.e. derelict, vicious, facinorous; neuter (singular) mischief, malice, or (plural) guilt; masculine (singular) the devil, or (plural) sinners See also {{g4191}}.

g4192.definition: [πόνος] from the base of {{g3993}}; toil, i.e. (by implication) anguish

g4193.definition: [Ποντικός] from {{g4195}}; a Pontican, i.e. native of Pontus

g4194.definition: [Πόντιος] of Latin origin; apparently bridged; Pontius, a Roman

g4195.definition: [Πόντος] of Latin origin; a sea; Pontus, a region of Asia Minor

g4196.definition: [Πόπλιος] of Latin origin; apparently "popular"; Poplius (i.e. Publius), a Roman

g4197.definition: [πορεία] from {{g4198}}; travel (by land); figuratively (plural) proceedings, i.e. career

g4198.definition: [πορεύομαι] middle voice from a derivative of the same as {{g3984}}; to traverse, i.e. travel (literally or figuratively; especially to remove (figuratively, die), live, etc.);

g4199.definition: [πορθέω] prolongation from πέρθω (to sack); to ravage (figuratively)

g4200.definition: [πορισμός] from a derivative of πόρος (a way, i.e. means); furnishing (procuring), i.e. (by implication) money-getting (acquisition)
